value.0: Leave me be. I have nothing to say to you.
Do you have need of me?
I would gladly go with you, but it looks like you have plenty of help as it is. Let me know when you truly need my help.
My skills and expertise will be better spent here than in a large party. Unless the situation changes, I will be here.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, I refuse. My skills and expertise will be better spent here than in a large party. Unless the situation changes, I will be here.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> How can I deny a friend in need? Of course, I'll be taking a share of the gold and treasure we find.
Then it begins once again. Into the flames we leap... let those who stand in our path beware. Of course, I'll be taking a share of the gold and treasure we find.
The Seer believes you are our prophetical savior; our only hope of defeating the Valsharess. I, however, do not believe in prophecies.
Still, you are obviously capable in your own right. And we need all the help we can get if we are to win this war. So I'm willing to take a chance.
Be well.
By stopping the Valsharess, of course... if you can. But even the Seer seems to realize you can't do this alone, prophecy or not. Fortunately, I may be able to help you out.
You do not have to. Just know that I judge an individual by their actions, not by any supposed destiny laid upon them. If you prove yourself, trust me... I shall be the first to cheer your victory.
Actually, I do hope the Seer is right about you. If you prove to be the agent of the Valsharess' destruction, all the better. But I won't bow down to you just because the Seer had a dream.
Yes, we are. Which is why I'm willing to help you, despite the fact that I know nothing about you. Hopefully you'll prove that the Seer's faith in you is justified.
You already have plenty of companions, <FirstName>. I don't like pooling all our resources in one place. Too easy to suffer a single catastrophic loss if something goes wrong.
My skills and expertise will be better spent here than in a large party. Unless the situation changes, I will be here.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, I refuse. My skills and expertise will be better spent here than in a large party. Unless the situation changes, I will be here.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Perhaps you are a little less capable than I thought. Then it's settled - I will assist you in your journey for a percentage of the loot.
I don't believe in the Seer's dreams, <FirstName>... though I do believe you want to stop the Valsharess. It's settled, I'll assist you in return for some of the gold and treasure we find.
I am yours to command.
If you wish. I would prefer not to leave you without proper defense, if it can be avoided.
So be it.
I shall go back to the temple in Lith My'athar, then. If you change your mind, you can meet me there.
Leave me be. I have nothing to say to you.
Speak to the Seer. She will explain everything.
Do you wish to die now? Because I can certainly arrange that!
I could use a fighter. Will you join me?
Fine. Forget I asked.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Be that as it may, I'll need all the help I can get, my friend.
I'll be going now.
And how am I supposed to prove myself?
I don't like your attitude, tiefling.
What if I don't want to prove myself to you?
We're all on the same side here.
I could use a fighter. Will you join me?
Fine. Forget I asked.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Be that as it may, I'll need all the help I can get to put a stop to the Valsharess.
Never mind.
I think we need to part ways.
No, never mind. Stay with me.
Go on. I'll meet up with you later.
I'd like to buy off some of the loot that you picked up.
